review_title: Great Place to Work - Great Culture!
pros: MOKA has a welcoming, caring & authentic culture that is easy to see in everything they do. There are many opportunities for career advancement. You can work with a purpose; plus it's rewarding work. You can contribute and give back in many ways. Great leadership who is open to feedback from all employees. There are opportunities to connect and be part of something bigger than yourself.
cons: Work life is different due to the pandemic. Not different in a bad way-just different.

review_title: A few great people, but the high stress, low pay, and constant demands outside work hours are overwhelming.
pros: The residents and some of the staff are amazing and become like family.
cons: The biggest problem is that if you do your job well, you get to do the work of 3 people due to turnover and burnout. The intense pressure of being on-call 24/7 while only getting a measly salary is very demotivating. Not a lot of growth potential.

job_title: Residential Support Staff in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: MOKA is a great non-profit. They offer employees lots PTO, health insurance options and value employee input. You will make relationships that you'll value forever. There is always lots of over time!
cons: The pay is low for the kind amount of work and stress involved... this varies depending by what location you work at. I found that the at the location I worked at that a lot of my co-workers had "given up" and put little effort into daily activities unless the house supervisor was present.

pros: The pro is that you can help people with disabilities, and help them become an important part of society.
cons: 24/7 coverage, almost no time off, lots of training, minimal pay. You get pto but it has to be approved 2 months in advance, and seniority gets first dibs. No holidays.

job_title: Records Assistant, Assistant Supervisor in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: MOKA offers flexible work schedules and calm relaxing work environment. This allows for you to take this job on as part-time. Good decentralized decision making process that involves all levels of employees.
cons: Poor pay and limited ability to move up the ladder. The pay cap and now cancelled 401k matching does not encourage longevity.

pros: Staff works well together. Problem solving is a team effort. Residents form a wonderful relationship with caregivers.There are good benefits with this company.
cons: shifts can be long due to staff illness. The job can be taxing on family life as it requires working on many holidays.

job_title: Community Living Supports in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Flexible schedule, great supervision, rewarding work.  Willing to work around changing class schedules. Communication is more than adequate.  Stays true to mission statement.  Overall great place to work.
cons: Pay isn't great, though raises do happen.
